00089 class Element: public cfp::ChemicalElementInterface, public QObject
00090 {
00091 public:
00093         typedef QPointer<Element> Ptr;
00094 
00096         typedef enum {
00097                 SYMBOL_PROPERTY,          
00098                 NAME_PROPERTY,            
00099 
00100                 NUCLEONS_PROPERTY,
00102                 ELECTRONS_PROPERTY,
00104                 ATOMIC_MASS_PROPERTY,
00107                 ABUNDANCE_PROPERTY,
00109                 NS_L_COHERENT_PROPERTY,
00111                 NS_L_INCOHERENT_PROPERTY,
00113                 NS_CS_COHERENT_PROPERTY,
00115                 NS_CS_INCOHERENT_PROPERTY,
00117                 NS_CS_TOTAL_PROPERTY,
00119                 NS_CS_ABSORPTION_PROPERTY,
00122                 XRAY_ENERGY_PROPERTY,
00124                 INVALID_PROPERTY
00125         } Property;
00128         typedef enum {
00129                 INT_TYPE,     
00130                 STRING_TYPE,  
00131                 DOUBLE_TYPE,  
00132                 COMPLEX_TYPE, 
00133                 INVALID_TYPE  
00134         } PropertyType; // has to have to same order as PropertyVariant, see propertyType()
00136         typedef boost::variant<int, std::string, double, complex> PropertyVariant;
00138         typedef std::vector<Property> PropertyVector;
00140         typedef std::vector<PropertyVariant> PropertyVariantVector;
00141         typedef PropertyVariantVector::const_iterator PropertyValueIteratorConst;
00142         typedef PropertyVariantVector::iterator PropertyValueIterator;
00145         static const int INVALID_PROPERTY_VALUE;
00146 public:
00152         Element();
00153 
00154         ~Element(); 
00155

00253 
00254 template<typename T>
00255 T Element::getValue(Property p) const 
00256 {
00257         try {   return boost::get<T>(propertyConst(p));
00258         } catch(boost::bad_get e) {
00259 #ifdef DEBUG
00260                 std::cerr << "exec " << propertyName(p) << std::endl;
00261 #endif
00262                 return defaultValue(T(), p);
00263         }
00264 }
00265 
00266 template<typename T>
00267 bool Element::setProperty(Property p, const T& value)
00268 {
00269         PropertyVariant var(value);
00270         // type check
00271         if (p == INVALID_PROPERTY ||
00272             !isValidType(p, var)) return false;
00273         // input data verification
00274         if (p == ELECTRONS_PROPERTY ||
00275             p == ABUNDANCE_PROPERTY ||
00276             p == ATOMIC_MASS_PROPERTY)
00277         {
00278                 if (value < T(0)) var = T(0);
00279         }
00280 
00281         mProperties.at(p) = var;
00282         return true;
00283 }
